info.title: AeroDB API
info.summary: AeroDB API provides access to airport, user, country, and NOTAM data.
info.description:
This is the AeroDB API, providing a large scale of various aeronautical data.


All properties are always returned and must be provided but can be null if not applicable.
Some endpoints require authentication via API key.

## Filtering, Sorting, and Pagination

Some operations allow you to filter, sort, and paginate results.

Example:

```json
/airports?filter={"name":"Geneva","countryCode":"CH"}&limit=10&page=2
```

*Results are limited to **100** items by default, this limit can be increased to 300 items per page.*


## Rate Limiting

This API use an IP address rate limit of around 10 queries /sec.

Reaching this rate limit will result in a 429 Too Many Requests response.

You can use the `X-Ratelimit-Limit` `X-Ratelimit-Reset-Ms` and `X-Ratelimit-Remaining` headers to check your current rate limit status.

get.description:
Return a list of Airlines

If unauthenticated, the result is limited to 5 items.

schema.description: Represents a paginated list of items.

get.description:
List airports with minimal details.

*Limit on this operation is increased*

Get a unique airport by its identifier.

This operation retreive additional information, including its runways and frequencies.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Airport Identifier , can be the id, ICAO code or IATA code

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result.

400.description: The server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax.

post.description:
Invalidate the previous validation token and send a new one.

- Send an email to the user with a password reset link.

- The new reset token will be valid for 1 hour.

- Previous validation token requests must be at least 15 minutes old.

- User must be authenticated.

400.description: The server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax.

post.description:
Invalidate the previous validation token and send a new one to the user's email.

- Send an email to the user with a verification link.

- User must NOT be verified already.

- The new verification token will be valid for 1 hour.

- Previous verification token requests must be at least 15 minutes old.

400.description: The server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax.

post.description: Update the user password using a valid reset token.

400.description: The server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax.

post.description: Verify the user account using the verification token sent via email.

400.description: The server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax.

404.description: The server cannot find the requested resource.

CurrentUser.description: User as visible by it's owner's session (/me endpoint).

countryCode.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the airline's primary country.

fleetSize.description: Number of aircraft in the airline's fleet.

operationStartDate.description: Date when the airline started operations.

operationEndDate.description: Date when the airline ceased operations.

icaoCode.description: ICAO airport code, a four-letter alphanumeric code

iataCode.description: IATA airport code, a three-letter alphanumeric code

isVFR.description: Indicates if the airport is VFR (Visual Flight Rules) capable

isIFR.description: Indicates if the airport is IFR (Instrument Flight Rules) capable

pprRequired.description: Indicates if prior permission is required for landing

isSnowtam.description:
Indicates if the NOTAM is a SNOWTAM.
A SNOWTAM (Snow and/or Ice NOTAM) is a special type of NOTAM (Notice to Airmen) issued by an airport to provide pilots with critical information about hazardous conditions on the movement area (runways and taxiways) caused by snow, ice, slush, frost, or standing water

isProcedure.description: Indicates if the NOTAM is related to a procedure.
